# Porting from .NET Framework

> Migrating applications from .NET Framework to modern .NET (.NET 6+). Use the .NET Upgrade Assistant tool for automated migration; address breaking changes in APIs, configuration, and dependencies. Key areas include replacing `System.Web` with ASP.NET Core, updating NuGet packages, and modernizing project files to SDK-style.

- [Breaking changes can affect porting your app](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/core/porting/breaking-changes.md): Breaking changes can occur when porting your code from .NET framework to .NET and between versions of .NET. This article describes categories of breaking changes, ways a change can affect compatibility and how to find breaking changes.
- [Migrate C++/CLI projects to .NET](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/core/porting/cpp-cli.md): Learn about porting C++/CLI projects to .NET.
- [Port from .NET Framework to .NET](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/core/porting/framework-overview.md): Understand the porting process and discover tools you might find helpful when porting a .NET Framework project to .NET.
- [Upgrade .NET apps overview](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/core/porting/index.md): Understand the aspects of upgrading from .NET Framework to .NET, upgrading to the latest .NET, and modernizing your app to the cloud.
- [Modernize your upgraded .NET Framework apps](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/core/porting/modernize.md): This article demonstrates some of the ways you can modernize a .NET Framework app after you've upgraded to .NET
- [.NET Framework technologies unavailable on .NET 6+](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/core/porting/net-framework-tech-unavailable.md): Learn about .NET Framework technologies that are unavailable on .NET 6 and later versions.
- [Porting approaches](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/core/porting/porting-approaches.md): Create a porting plan that best reflects your project and context.
- [Prerequisites to port from .NET Framework](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/core/porting/premigration-needed-changes.md): Before porting your code from .NET Framework to .NET, you must use the correct developer environment and update your project files as required.
- [Organize projects for .NET Framework and .NET](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/core/porting/project-structure.md): Help for project owners who want to compile their solution against .NET Framework and .NET side by side.
- [Analyze dependencies to port code](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/core/porting/third-party-deps.md): Learn how to analyze external dependencies to port your project from .NET Framework to .NET.
- [Discover unsupported APIs in your app](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/core/porting/unsupported-apis.md): Learn about how to find unsupported APIs your app might be using, and what to do about them.
- [.NET Upgrade Assistant code analysis overview](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/core/porting/upgrade-assistant-analyze-overview.md): Describes how the code analysis function of .NET Upgrade Assistant works. The analysis generates a report that lists what aspects of your project will be upgraded, and if any manual work is involved.
- [How to analyze a project with .NET Upgrade Assistant](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/core/porting/upgrade-assistant-how-to-analyze.md): Learn how to analyze one or more projects with .NET Upgrade Assistant. Before upgrading, it's a good idea to perform code analysis on your projects so that you understand if extra effort is required after upgrading.
- [How to upgrade a project with .NET Upgrade Assistant](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/core/porting/upgrade-assistant-how-to-upgrade.md): Learn how to upgrade one or more projects with .NET Upgrade Assistant using either Visual Studio or a terminal.
- [Install .NET Upgrade Assistant](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/core/porting/upgrade-assistant-install.md): Learn how to install .NET Upgrade Assistant as a Visual Studio extension or a .NET Global Tool. .NET Upgrade Assistant assists you when upgrading projects to the latest dependencies or when upgrading to a new .NET
- [.NET Upgrade Assistant Overview](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/core/porting/upgrade-assistant-overview.md): Learn more about .NET Upgrade Assistant for .NET-related projects. This tool helps you upgrade from older versions of .NET, including .NET Framework, to the latest version of .NET. Code incompatibilities can be fixed as part of the upgrade.
- [Upgrade Assistant Telemetry](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/core/porting/upgrade-assistant-telemetry.md): Learn about telemetry collected by the Upgrade Assistant.
- [Upgrade WCF Server-side Project to CoreWCF](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/core/porting/upgrade-assistant-wcf.md): Use .NET Upgrade Assistant to upgrade an existing WCF Server-side project on .NET Framework to use CoreWCF services on .NET 6 or later.
- [.NET SDK, MSBuild, and Visual Studio versioning](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/core/porting/versioning-sdk-msbuild-vs.md): Learn about the versioning relationship between the .NET SDK and MSBuild/VS.
- [Use the Windows Compatibility Pack to port code](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/core/porting/windows-compat-pack.md): Learn about the Windows Compatibility Pack and how can you use it to port existing .NET Framework code to .NET.

## Topic Indices

- [Github Copilot App Modernization Docs](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/core/porting/github-copilot-app-modernization/llms.txt): 3 topics; Github Copilot App Modernization Docs documentation and reference.
